sourceMeaningMnemonic: You need to <radical>run</radical> on your <radical>toe</radical>s if you want to <kanji>proceed</kanji> down this road. If you can't run on your toes, well then you're out of luck, and you won't be able to <kanji>move on</kanji> at all. I didn't make this rule, I just enforce it. Now run!
meaningInfo: Imagine trying to proceed down the road by running on your toes. No other part of your foot can touch the ground!
readingMnemonic: If you find that you can't <kanji>proceed</kanji>, you're a <reading>foo</reading>l (<ja>ふ</ja>). Everyone can run on their toes. Don't you know that? No? Then you're an even bigger fool, now get outta here!
readingInfo: Imagine being called a fool when you can't proceed along the road because running on your toes ends up being super hard to do.
